result.execSummary:
The defendant James Lavell Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment. Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation. Follow any recommended treatment.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Take any and all medications as prescribed.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised deendant that as a convicted felon he may never posess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Restitution in the amounts of:  $785.00 payable to Mary H.; $1,000.00 payable to Doc P.; $60.00 payable to Church of Good Hope.  (Amounts/assessments  are on/showing on 14CF676)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Lavell Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (29 pages) commencing DECEMBER 15, 2014 received and filed. kl

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. No changes made to the PSI or the Sentencing Memorandum.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by:  victim's daughter/defendant's aunt, Dorothy F.; defendant's brother, Antonio J.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. 
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit for 271 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligibile for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Take any and all medications as prescribed.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Seek and maintain full time employment.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.    The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $785.00 payable to Mary H.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to Doc P.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
PAY restitution in the amount of $60.00 payable to Church of Good Hope.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Letter to the Court; from the defendant.
SENTENCING MEMORANDUM prepared and filed by Public Defender's Office Client Services Specialist, Ana Maria Guzman.
as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Suzanne Lisowski; filed.
for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson IN CUSTODY.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to Theft from Person - Movable Property [a Class G FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e).

NO AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant pled GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

**Court ordered a PSI with a recommendation.

Case adjourned to 12-15-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant James Lavell Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense needs more time to review discovery.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 10-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Projected Plea Hearing.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant James Lavell Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Projected Plea Hearing today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
Defense is currently reviewing State's offer.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 09-08-2014 at 8:30 AM for Adjourned Projected Plea Hearing - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
to Judge Donald; from the defendant - filed.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant James Lavell Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Bail is currently set at $2,500.00 cash.  Defense's motion to modify bail to a decreased amount argued and DENIED.  Court ordered bail to remain set as $2,500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point Pretrial Services with the same conditions of release as previously ordered.

Case adjourned to the already scheduled Projected Plea Hearing date on 07-24-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Upon the request of Atty. Darryl Smith via email, Clerk scheduled this matter for a Bail/Bond Hearing on 07-14-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.  ADA Joanne Hardtke notified of said court date via email.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant James Lavell Johnson not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a projected Plea Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant James Lavell Johnson not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 2.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson IN CUSTODY.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a bail/bond hearing and scheduling conference.

AS TO BAIL:  Bail is currently set at $2,500.00 cash.  Defense moves to modify the cash bail to a signature bond with turnover to Justice Point.  State objects.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIED  defense's motion to modify bail to a signature bond.  $2,500.00 cash bail remains the same.

Defense requests a status conference date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 05-15-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Damon Wilcox-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WALTER F.,ETHEL F., DOROTHY F., DENISE J. AND TONY J.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for James Lavell Johnson
Current: 4070 N 51ST ST, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 03-23-2014)
Prior: 3750 N 24th Pl, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant James Lavell Johnson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Lavell Johnson in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
